guides.title: From LangChain
guides.overview: LangChain provides a powerful abstraction layer for building LLM applications, but it comes with significant overhead. forAgents.dev offers pre-built, community-maintained skills that eliminate boilerplate while giving you the same capabilities with less code and maintenance burden.
prerequisites: Access to your LangChain project source code
Understanding of your current tool/chain implementations

steps.title: Audit your LangChain tools and chains
steps.description: List all LangChain tools, chains, and custom implementations in your current project. Document their purpose and dependencies.

code.before:
from langchain.tools import Tool
from langchain.agents import initialize_agent

# Custom tool implementations
tools = [
    Tool(name="WebSearch", func=search_web, description="Search the web"),
    Tool(name="Calculator", func=calculate, description="Perform calculations"),
    Tool(name="FileReader", func=read_file, description="Read files")
]
code.after:
# List skills you'll need:
# - web-search
# - calculator  
# - file-operations

steps.title: Browse the forAgents.dev skills directory
steps.description: Visit /skills to find matching capabilities. Most LangChain tools have equivalent skills already published.

code.before:
# Manual tool implementation in LangChain
def search_web(query: str) -> str:
    # 50+ lines of implementation
    # API key management
    # Error handling
    # Rate limiting
    pass
code.after:
# Browse https://foragents.dev/skills
# Find: web-search skill
# One-line install (next step)

steps.title: Install matching skills
steps.description: Use the one-line installer for each skill you need. Skills auto-load into ~/.openclaw/skills/

code.before:
# Install LangChain and dependencies
pip install langchain langchain-openai langchain-community
pip install google-search-results serpapi
code.after:
# Install skills
curl -fsSL https://foragents.dev/api/skills/web-search.sh | bash
curl -fsSL https://foragents.dev/api/skills/calculator.sh | bash
curl -fsSL https://foragents.dev/api/skills/file-operations.sh | bash

steps.title: Configure your agent workspace
steps.description: Set up AGENTS.md and SOUL.md to define your agent's personality and capabilities. Skills load automatically.

code.before:
agent = initialize_agent(
    tools=tools,
    llm=OpenAI(temperature=0),
    agent="zero-shot-react-description",
    verbose=True
)
code.after:
# SOUL.md
You are a helpful research assistant.
You can search the web, perform calculations, and read files.

# Skills auto-load from ~/.openclaw/skills/
# No manual tool registration needed

steps.title: Test skill functionality
steps.description: Verify each installed skill works as expected. Use openclaw test or manual testing.

code.before:
# Test LangChain agent
result = agent.run("Search for AI news and summarize")
print(result)
code.after:
# Test via OpenClaw
openclaw chat "Search for AI news and summarize"

# Or use the web interface
# Skills are available immediately

steps.title: Migrate conversation flows
steps.description: Replace LangChain's conversation memory with OpenClaw's memory/ directory system.

code.before:
from langchain.memory import ConversationBufferMemory

memory = ConversationBufferMemory(
    memory_key="chat_history",
    return_messages=True
)
code.after:
# memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md auto-created
# MEMORY.md for long-term memory
# Agent reads these files on startup

steps.title: Remove LangChain dependencies
steps.description: Once verified, uninstall LangChain packages and remove old code from your project.

code.before:
# requirements.txt
langchain==0.1.0
langchain-openai==0.0.5
langchain-community==0.0.20
serpapi==0.1.5
code.after:
# Clean requirements.txt
# (Only your custom business logic remains)
# Skills handle all tool integrations

commonPitfalls.solution: Ensure skills are installed in ~/.openclaw/skills/ and SKILL.md exists in each skill directory.
Check each skill's SKILL.md for required environment variables. Add them to your .env file.
Break complex chains into smaller tasks. Use BACKLOG.md to define multi-step workflows for your agent.

commonPitfalls.issue: Agent not using skills in responses
commonPitfalls.solution: Verify skills are listed when you run 'openclaw skills list'. Restart your agent session if needed.

guides.title: From CrewAI
guides.overview: CrewAI excels at multi-agent orchestration, but requires significant boilerplate for agent definitions and task management. forAgents.dev uses a file-based approach with AGENTS.md and BACKLOG.md that's simpler to maintain and extend.
prerequisites: Understanding of your agent roles and tasks

steps.title: Map CrewAI agents to forAgents roles
steps.description: Document each agent in your crew: their role, goal, backstory, and tools. These will translate to SOUL.md entries.

code.before:
from crewai import Agent

researcher = Agent(
    role="Researcher",
    goal="Find accurate information on any topic",
    backstory="Expert researcher with 10 years experience",
    tools=[search_tool, scraper_tool],
    verbose=True
)
code.after:
# SOUL.md
You are a Researcher.
Your goal is to find accurate information on any topic.
You are an expert researcher with 10 years of experience.

# Skills: web-search, web-scraper

steps.title: Convert tasks to BACKLOG.md format
steps.description: CrewAI tasks become checklist items in BACKLOG.md. The agent picks them up automatically.

code.before:
from crewai import Task

task = Task(
    description="Research AI trends in 2024",
    agent=researcher,
    expected_output="Detailed report with sources"
)
code.after:
# BACKLOG.md
## Research Tasks
- [ ] Research AI trends in 2024 (detailed report with sources)

# Agent processes tasks from BACKLOG.md via heartbeat

steps.title: Install skill equivalents for CrewAI tools
steps.description: Replace CrewAI tools with forAgents.dev skills. Most common tools have skill equivalents.

code.after:
# Install skills
curl -fsSL https://foragents.dev/api/skills/web-search.sh | bash
curl -fsSL https://foragents.dev/api/skills/web-scraper.sh | bash  
curl -fsSL https://foragents.dev/api/skills/file-operations.sh | bash

steps.title: Set up agent memory directories
steps.description: CrewAI's memory becomes OpenClaw's memory/ directory structure with daily logs and long-term memory.

code.before:
from crewai import Crew

crew = Crew(
    agents=[researcher, writer],
    tasks=[research_task, write_task],
    memory=True,
    verbose=2
)
code.after:
# memory/2026-02-09.md - daily notes
# MEMORY.md - long-term learnings
# Agent reads on startup, writes during work

steps.title: Configure multi-agent coordination
steps.description: For multi-agent setups, use agent-team-kit or define coordination in AGENTS.md.

code.before:
crew = Crew(
    agents=[researcher, writer, editor],
    tasks=[research, write, edit],
    process=Process.sequential
)
code.after:
# Install agent-team-kit for multi-agent
curl -fsSL https://foragents.dev/api/team-kit.sh | bash

# Define roles in AGENTS.md
# Use BACKLOG.md for task routing

steps.title: Enable proactive behavior with heartbeats
steps.description: Replace CrewAI's kickoff() with OpenClaw's heartbeat system for autonomous agents.

code.before:
# Manually trigger crew
result = crew.kickoff()
print(result)
code.after:
# HEARTBEAT.md
Check BACKLOG.md for pending tasks.
If tasks exist, work on the next one.
Update memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md with progress.

# Runs automatically every ~30 min

steps.title: Test and validate agent behavior
steps.description: Run your agent and verify it picks up tasks, uses skills correctly, and maintains memory.

code.before:
# Test CrewAI crew
crew.kickoff(inputs={"topic": "AI agents"})
code.after:
# Test OpenClaw agent
openclaw chat "Work on the research task"

# Or let heartbeat handle it automatically

commonPitfalls.issue: Tasks not being picked up from BACKLOG.md
commonPitfalls.solution: Ensure HEARTBEAT.md includes instructions to check BACKLOG.md. Verify heartbeat is enabled.
Use agent-team-kit skill for structured multi-agent setups, or define clear coordination rules in AGENTS.md.
Refine SOUL.md to match your CrewAI agent's backstory and personality. Add specific traits and speaking style.
Check that memory/ directory exists and MEMORY.md is being updated. Agent must read MEMORY.md on startup.

guides.title: From Custom Framework
guides.overview: Custom agent frameworks give you full control but require ongoing maintenance. forAgents.dev lets you keep your unique logic while offloading common functionality to community-maintained skills.
prerequisites: Documentation of your custom agent's capabilities
List of external APIs and integrations used

steps.title: Document your current agent architecture
steps.description: Create a comprehensive list of your agent's capabilities, workflows, and custom implementations.

code.after:
# Document in migration-notes.md
Tools to migrate:
- weather → weather skill
- email → email skill  
- calendar → calendar skill
- search → web-search skill
Custom logic to preserve:
- Specific workflow rules
- Business logic
- API authentication

steps.title: Search forAgents.dev for equivalent skills
steps.description: Browse /skills and /integrations to find pre-built alternatives to your custom implementations.

code.after:
# Instead of custom implementation:
curl -fsSL https://foragents.dev/api/skills/weather.sh | bash

# Maintained by community, includes:
# - Multiple weather API support
# - Error handling
# - Caching
# - Unit conversions

steps.title: Install skills for common functionality
steps.description: Replace your custom tool implementations with skills one at a time, testing as you go.

code.before:
# 500+ lines of custom tool code across multiple files
# weather.py - 80 lines
# email_client.py - 120 lines  
# calendar_sync.py - 150 lines
# web_search.py - 100 lines
# Plus error handling, tests, docs...
code.after:
# Install pre-built skills
curl -fsSL https://foragents.dev/api/skills/weather.sh | bash
curl -fsSL https://foragents.dev/api/skills/email.sh | bash
curl -fsSL https://foragents.dev/api/skills/calendar.sh | bash  
curl -fsSL https://foragents.dev/api/skills/web-search.sh | bash

# Zero maintenance, community updates

steps.title: Migrate custom business logic to workspace files
steps.description: Move agent-specific behavior to SOUL.md, AGENTS.md, and workflow files.

code.after:
# SOUL.md
You are a helpful and concise assistant.

## Rules
- Always verify sources before sharing information
- Summarize findings before responding
- Log all actions to memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md

steps.title: Set up memory and state management
steps.description: Replace your custom state management with OpenClaw's file-based memory system.

code.after:
# File-based memory (automatic)
# memory/2026-02-09.md - daily logs
# MEMORY.md - long-term memory
# Agent reads on startup, writes during work
# No custom state management needed

steps.title: Integrate remaining custom code
steps.description: For truly unique logic, create a custom skill or keep it as a local implementation.

code.before:
# Proprietary business logic
def custom_workflow(data):
    # Your unique secret sauce
    # Can't be replaced by generic skill
    pass
code.after:
# Option 1: Keep as custom skill in ~/.openclaw/skills/my-custom/
# Option 2: Contribute to forAgents.dev if shareable
# Option 3: Call from agent via exec tool

steps.title: Run parallel testing
steps.description: Keep your old system running while testing the new OpenClaw setup to ensure feature parity.

code.before:
# Old system still running
python my_agent.py --task "daily report"
code.after:
# New system (parallel)
openclaw chat "Generate daily report"

# Compare outputs, verify all features work
# Gradually shift traffic to new system

steps.title: Deprecate old codebase
steps.description: Once verified, archive your custom code and fully migrate to the OpenClaw + skills approach.

code.before:
# Before: 2000+ lines of custom code
# Constant maintenance, dependency updates
# You own all the bugs
code.after:
# After: ~100 lines of unique logic
# Community maintains skills
# Focus on what makes your agent special

commonPitfalls.issue: No exact skill match for custom functionality
commonPitfalls.solution: Check /integrations for MCP servers, or create a custom skill. You can also combine multiple skills to replicate complex behavior.
Migrate incrementally. Start with one tool/capability, verify it works, then move to the next. Don't do everything at once.
Use OpenClaw's env var system or create a custom skill wrapper for your auth. Skills can call your existing auth code.
Skills are lightweight shell scripts with minimal overhead. Benchmark before and after to verify performance.

guides.title: Upgrading v1 to v2
guides.overview: forAgents.dev v2 introduces breaking changes for better performance and scalability. This guide helps you upgrade from v1 to v2 smoothly.
prerequisites: OpenClaw CLI updated to latest version
Git repository for rollback if needed

steps.title: Update OpenClaw CLI to v2
steps.description: Install the latest OpenClaw CLI which includes v2 support and breaking change warnings.

code.before:
# Check current version
openclaw --version
# Output: openclaw/1.x.x
code.after:
# Update to v2
curl -fsSL https://openclaw.com/install.sh | bash

# Verify
openclaw --version
# Output: openclaw/2.0.0+

steps.title: Rename workspace files (breaking change)
steps.description: v2 renamed several workspace files for clarity. BOOTSTRAP.md is now optional, and CONTEXT.md was removed.

code.before:
~/.openclaw/workspace/
├── BOOTSTRAP.md
├── CONTEXT.md  
├── SOUL.md
└── AGENTS.md
code.after:
~/.openclaw/workspace/
├── SOUL.md (unchanged)
├── AGENTS.md (unchanged)
├── USER.md (new - replaces CONTEXT.md)
└── BOOTSTRAP.md (optional, delete after first run)

steps.title: Update skill installation paths
steps.description: v2 changed skill directory structure for better organization and versioning.

code.before:
# v1 skills
~/.openclaw/skills/
├── web-search.sh
├── email.sh  
└── calendar.sh
code.after:
# v2 skills (versioned)
~/.openclaw/skills/
├── web-search/
│   ├── SKILL.md
│   └── v2.0.0/
├── email/
│   ├── SKILL.md
│   └── v1.5.0/
└── calendar/
    ├── SKILL.md
    └── v1.3.0/

steps.title: Reinstall skills using v2 installers
steps.description: Skills need to be reinstalled to use the new directory structure. Your old skills will continue to work but won't receive updates.

code.before:
# v1 skill install
curl -fsSL https://foragents.dev/skills/web-search.sh | bash
code.after:
# v2 skill install (same URL, new structure)
curl -fsSL https://foragents.dev/api/skills/web-search.sh | bash

# Or use openclaw CLI
openclaw skills install web-search

steps.title: Update memory directory structure
steps.description: v2 introduces structured memory with better organization for long-term storage.

code.before:
# v1 memory
~/.openclaw/workspace/memory/
├── 2026-02-08.md
└── 2026-02-09.md
code.after:
# v2 memory (organized by month)
~/.openclaw/workspace/memory/
├── 2026-02/
│   ├── 08.md
│   └── 09.md
└── MEMORY.md (unchanged)

steps.title: Update heartbeat configuration
steps.description: v2 heartbeat system supports more granular control and scheduling.

code.before:
# v1 HEARTBEAT.md - simple checklist
- Check email
- Check calendar
- Check tasks
code.after:
# v2 HEARTBEAT.md - structured with timing
## Every 30 min
- Check email (if not checked in last 30 min)
  
## Every 2 hours  
- Check calendar (upcoming 24h)

## Every 6 hours
- Review BACKLOG.md tasks

steps.title: Test v2 features
steps.description: Verify your agent works with v2 and test new features like improved skill versioning and memory search.

code.before:
# v1 - basic functionality
openclaw chat "What's on my calendar?"
code.after:
# v2 - enhanced features
openclaw chat "What's on my calendar?"

# New: skill version management
openclaw skills list --versions

# New: memory search
openclaw memory search "calendar events"

steps.title: Review changelog and new features
steps.description: Check the full v2 changelog for new features, improvements, and additional breaking changes.

code.before:
# Review changes
open https://openclaw.com/changelog
code.after:
# v2 highlights:
# - Faster skill loading
# - Better error messages  
# - Memory search
# - Skill versioning
# - Improved heartbeat scheduling
# - Performance improvements

commonPitfalls.solution: Reinstall all skills using v2 installers. Old skills in flat structure won't auto-update.
Migrate existing daily files to YYYY-MM/ folder structure. Or wait for agent to create new files automatically.
Replace all CONTEXT.md references with USER.md. Content should be migrated manually.
Update HEARTBEAT.md to use v2 structured format with timing intervals. Old format may trigger too often.
